messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] daughter wants e-mail pen pal
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Stacey, I also have a 10 year old daughter that is interested in having an unschooling email friend.  Her name is Alex, and we are in our second year of
messages.messageBody:
Hi Stacey,

I also have a 10 year old daughter that is interested
in having an unschooling email friend. Her name is
Alex, and we are in our second year of unschooling,
but haven't met any local unschoolers either. If your
daughter would like to email mine, she can use my
email addy: psychomom95@.... This is going to
be lots of fun.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] daughter wants e-mail pen pal
messages.msgSnippet: my sons joined the we are unschoolers too! They love all the interaction from other unschoolers too.  Lots of different topics.  Thanks Anne & Jake (I think
messages.messageBody:
my sons joined the "we are unschoolers" too! They love all the interaction from other unschoolers too. Lots of different topics. Thanks Anne & Jake (I think I remember your sons name that really wanted it started, right?) Jana mom/friend to Jake(12) & Josh(10) in Kentucky

Susan <SusanYvonne@...> wrote: > Do you have a daughter that might be interested in having an e-mail pen pal?
> My daughter is 10 and would love to meet some other unschool girls to e-mail back and forth with. They don't have to be the same age. Her closer friends range in age from 7-14.

My daughter (8) joined the new yahoo group Anne Ohman created for kids:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/weareunschoolers/

She says there is lots of chatting going on between kids of different
ages. She did the e-pal thing for a while but it didn't really take
off like she hoped. She told me this is easier because it's lots of
kids to talk with instead of one person and everyone can share the
things they like with everyone else. I think she really likes that
it's other unschoolers. She can talk freely about video games and
Harry Potter, lol. Maybe your daughter would enjoy it, too?

~ Susan





---------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] daughter wants e-mail pen pal
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Wildflower/Vanessa My daughet is 11, we are living in Barcelona, Spain at the moment have just been sent here with DH s work from the UK and she is feeling
messages.messageBody:
Hi Wildflower/Vanessa

My daughet is 11, we are living in Barcelona, Spain at the moment have
just been sent here with DH's work from the UK and she is feeling a bit
lost s most of the kids in the Homeschool groups speak Spanish She would
love an e-penpal (or 2, or, 3). She has her own email address so you can
mail her there - hannah@...

Sarah

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] daughter wants e-mail pen pal
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Wildflower I have a 10 year old that would be keen to have an unschooling e-mail friend. We ve been unschooling for nearly a year and have not found any
messages.messageBody:
Hi Wildflower
I have a 10 year old that would be keen to have an unschooling e-mail friend.
We've been unschooling for nearly a year and have not found any local unschoolers.
I also have an 8 yo son and although they do enjoy playing together, it's nice for girls to have girlfriends.
Looking forward to getting to know you all.
You can check us out on our blog www.climbingthefarawaytree.blogspot.com
Stacey




----- Original Message -----
From: Wildflower Car
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2007 2:13 PM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] daughter wants e-mail pen pal



Do you have a daughter that might be interested in having an e-mail pen pal?
My daughter is 10 and would love to meet some other unschool girls to e-mail back and forth with. They don't have to be the same age. Her closer friends range in age from 7-14.

Let me know!
Wildflower

messages.messageBody:
> Do you have a daughter that might be interested in having an e-mail pen pal?
> My daughter is 10 and would love to meet some other unschool girls to e-mail back and forth with. They don't have to be the same age. Her closer friends range in age from 7-14.


My daughter (8) joined the new yahoo group Anne Ohman created for kids:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/weareunschoolers/

She says there is lots of chatting going on between kids of different
ages. She did the e-pal thing for a while but it didn't really take
off like she hoped. She told me this is easier because it's lots of
kids to talk with instead of one person and everyone can share the
things they like with everyone else. I think she really likes that
it's other unschoolers. She can talk freely about video games and
Harry Potter, lol. Maybe your daughter would enjoy it, too?

~ Susan
